intro: Xerotes hastilis, commonly known as the desert spurge, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions. It is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and small, yellowish flowers that bloom in the summer. The plant is adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments through its ability to store water in its thick stems and leaves. It has a shallow root system that allows it to absorb moisture quickly from infrequent rains. Xerotes hastilis is often found in sandy soils and is considered a pioneer species in disturbed or degraded habitats.
